articles.description: Follow live text & score updates from matchday three in the Europa League and Europa Conference League.
articles.title: Build-up to West Ham & Aston Villa in Europe before Liverpool and Brighton play

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary and follow text updates as Rangers visit Sparta Prague in the Europa League before Aberdeen host PAOK in the Conference League.
articles.title: Europa League: Rangers travel to face Sparta Prague

articles.description: Aston Villa ooze class as they cruise to a comfortable victory against AZ Alkmaar in the Europa Conference League.
articles.title: Villa cruise to Conference League win at AZ Alkmaar

articles.description: Rangers emerged with a precious Europa League point from Prague after a testing night against Sparta.
articles.title: Rangers hold on for point against Sparta Prague

articles.description: England's World Cup is all but over after a shambolic eight-wicket defeat by Sri Lanka in Bengaluru.
articles.title: England facing early exit after sorry Sri Lanka loss

articles.description: West Ham suffer their first Europa League defeat of the season as David Moyes' side are narrowly beaten at Olympiakos in Group A.
articles.title: West Ham slip to narrow defeat at Olympiakos

articles.description: England's World Cup future is out of their hands after they lose by eight wickets to Sri Lanka in Bangalore at the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Dismal England slump to crushing Sri Lanka defeat

articles.description: New Zealand make one change to the side for their World Cup final with South Africa as lock Brodie Retallick replaces Sam Whitelock.
articles.title: Retallick replaces Whitelock for All Blacks in final

articles.description: South Africa hooker Bongi Mbonambi will start against New Zealand in Saturday's Rugby World Cup final after a ruling there was "insufficient evidence" he used a racial slur towards Tom Curry.
articles.title: Mbonambi clear to start World Cup final

articles.description: Newcastle and Italy midfielder Sandro Tonali is banned for 10 months by the Italian Football Federation for breaching betting rules.
articles.title: Tonali banned for 10 months for betting rule breaches
